content: v-neck cardigans for mini ag dolls by dawn smith you will need  2 size 1 needles  fingering weight yarn  4 stitch markers one of them should be a different color than the others you only need the different color for the long-sleeved version  2 or 4 stitch holders very small ones- i use large safety pins only needed for the long-sleeved version  tapestry needle  optional - tiny buttons abbreviations k- knit p - purl kfb - knit into front and back of next stitch to increase by 1 k2tog - knit 2 together to decrease by 1 sts stitches w&t wrap and turn techniques wrap and turn short row short-sleeved version only knit front and back increase knit two together decrease long-sleeved version only k1 p1 ribbing - knit the knit stitches and purl the purl stitches if you prefer you can do your favorite paired increases before and after the stitch markers at this scale it s hard to see if they are paired or not tutorial for wrap and turn short row https //knotions com/issues/april-2018/tutorial-april-2018/tutorial-short-row-garter-stitch/ this tutorial has photos if you haven t done a wrap and turn on garter stitch before 1 ---- pattern starts here for short sleeved version ---- with #1 needles cast on 18 stitches row 1 knit 3 stitches place marker on needle front knit 3 more stitches place marker on needle sleeve knit 6 stitches place marker on needle back knit 3 stitches place marker on needle sleeve knit 3 remaining stitches front row 2 k1 kfb k1 slip marker repeat directions in brackets k1 kfb k2 kfb k1 slip marker repeat directions in brackets k1 kfb k1 24 sts row 3 k2 purl slipping markers in this and all other purl row to last 2 stitches k2 row 4 k to within 2 stitches of marker kfb k1 slip marker k1 kfb in next stitch repeat directions in brackets 3 more times k to end of row 32 sts row 5 k2 purl slipping markers to last 2 stitches k2 row 6-11 repeat row 4 & 5 until there are 16 stitches between markers for back 56 sts short sleeved version row 12 k20 to 2nd marker remove marker w&t k12 remove marker w&t replace marker bobble 12 k27 repeat * k7 32 sts 8-16-8 row 13 k2 purl to within last 2 stitches k2 row 14 knit increasing before and after markers as row 4 above 36 stitches row 15 k2 purl to within last 2 stitches k2 row 16 knit increasing before and after markers as row 4 above 40 stitches row 17 k2 purl removing markers to within last 2 stitches k2 row 18 knit row 19 k2 purl to within last 2 stitches k2 row 20-22 knit cast off knitwise until 2 stitches remain knit those 2 stitches together then bind off last stitch this will give you a nice square edge at the bottom weave in ends if desired sew
